message.content: This question requires knowledge about the daily movement of the sky. The back and forth movement referred to in the question is the movement of the sun from east to west during the course of a day. This happens once during a single rotation of the Earth on its axis. Option (B) is incorrect because a cycle of the sun refers to a year, not a day. Option (C) is incorrect because the winter solstice refers to the shortest day of the year, not the daily movement of the sky. Option (D) is incorrect because the moon's position does not affect the daily movement of the sky.
